alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 1:53PM MST until December 28 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW FOR THE HIGHER MOUNTAINS THROUGH TONIGHT... .Snow showers will increase by early evening, and another round of heavier snow is expected during the night tonight. Mountain roads will remain snow covered and slick. Blowing and drifting snow can be expected over the higher passes and above timberline. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches by Tuesday morning. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range, and The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...Snow will increase this evening and may be heavy at times overnight. The snow will diminish significantly Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel will be hazardous due to snow covered roads and areas of blowing and drifting snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Be prepared for travel delays or intermittent road closures. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
